meanings.definition: People who oppress or harass others, especially for their beliefs or identity.
meanings.sent1: The persecutors targeted those who spoke out against them.
meanings.sent2: The community stood up against the persecutors to protect their rights.
meanings.sent3: The persecutors tried to silence the activists, but their voices grew louder.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the persecutors loomed over the vulnerable population.
meanings.sent5: The faces of the persecutors were etched in the minds of the oppressed.

meanings.definition: Those who subject others to hostility or ill-treatment.
meanings.sent1: The persecutors showed no mercy to their victims.
meanings.sent2: The persecutors' actions caused fear and distress among the community.
meanings.sent3: The persecutors' behavior was so outrageous, it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The words of the persecutors cut deeper than any blade.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the persecutors cast a dark cloud over the town.

meanings.definition: Individuals who cause suffering or hardship to others through mistreatment.
meanings.sent1: The persecutors' cruelty knew no bounds.
meanings.sent2: The victims sought justice against their persecutors.
meanings.sent3: The persecutors' tactics backfired, leading to their own downfall.
meanings.sent4: The scars left by the persecutors never truly healed.
meanings.sent5: The cries of the persecuted echoed in the ears of the persecutors.
